item.title: It is good even if it is cold! With a sled!
item.description:
It is good even if it is cold! With a sled!

Gwangjin-gu, Seoul, Korea

Prepared for those who have been sick in the long winter. You can feel free to play with a light pocket. In addition, it is easily reached by public transportation in downtown Seoul. Introducing a half-day winter playground for everyone of all ages, including sledding and skating rinks in Seoul.

You must be close. Feel free to reach even by public transport. It's because you have to be able to run anytime without having a big heart like a ski resort at the foot of the mountain. To get children up, convenient transportation is a must. This is also true of the two dating families. What if you could easily find it by public transport anytime and spend an exciting day this winter without spending a lot of money?
Ears are brushed. In Seoul Seoul Plaza Skating Rink First of all World Cup Park Ice Sledding Ground, Ttukseom River Park Snow Sledding Ground, Boramae Park Ice Sledding Ground, Nodeul Garden Ice Sledding Ground, Garden Five Ice Garden, Guro Anyangcheon Snow Sledding Ground, Sangam MBC Skating Ground, Seoul Land Sledding Ground, Yangjaecheon Ice Sledding Ground, Dorimcheon Children's Sledding Ground, Jungnangcheon Skating rink and children's hall This place. While looking for a sledding range to enjoy the day, I decided to visit the Ttukseom River Park sledding range and the Children's Hall sledding range that are suitable for 'convenient transportation' and 'low price'. I added the Seoul Plaza Skating Rink which adds a more romantic atmosphere (because winter nights in the city are beautiful). Let's go to Ttukseom Hangang Park sledding range first.

Exciting Children Sledding Down the Snow
Transformation Ttukseom Han River Park Pool! Sledding Range in Winter!
Ttukseom Hangang Park Sledding Range is located in Ttukseom Hangang Park. You will see it immediately after exit 2 of Ttukseom Park Station. Based on the sledding grounds, it has a small play area such as a mini viking, an air bumper car and a room. There is also a winter celebrity, smelt fishing experience (4,000 won), which is perfect for a half-day playground. Yeouido sledding range which opened together did not open this year.
Low slopes are available for children
Ttukseom Hangang Park Sledding Range, which opened on December 18, is scheduled to operate until February 22. The original notice went out to February 15, but said it would extend the operating period to 22 days at the on-site ticket booth. Hours of operation are from 9:00 am to 5:00 pm on weekdays and weekends. There is no day off but may be temporarily adjusted in case of bad weather. The sledding playground will be closed for one hour every day from noon. Remember
Low slopes are available for children
Tickets for sledding ranges at 6,000 won, and free passes including the trampoline, bomber car, minibikes and electric cars are 10,000 won. Admission ticket for smelt fishing experience in the sledding range is 4000 won.
More fun with mom and dad!
Let's start with the sledding range. As it can be used for more than 36 months, it is equipped with a 30m small sledding range and an 80m large sledding range to prevent safety accidents. The small size is only available for under 6 years from 36 months. In addition, plastic sleds and tube sleds are available for various sled experiences.
More fun with mom and dad!
Adults like it more! Sledding Range next to Children's Grand Park!
Many people visited the smelt fishing experience area next to the sledding range. Only 10 can be caught at a time, but even those who haven't visited the smelt festival can enjoy catching smelt. The smelt from the smelt fishing experience field is taken to a shelter next to it and washed for 2000 won and then fried. Fish cakes and drinks are available. If you want to have a cup of tea while looking at the Han River after exciting sleds and smelt fishing, head to the Ttukseom Viewing Culture Complex. The sledding tour can be completed at a cultural retreat with a library and café.
Squid fishing without words!
The Children's Hall sledding range is not far from Ttukseom River Park sledding range. Located next to Children's Grand Park, it is also called Children's Grand Park Sledding Range. It also operates until February 22. Exit at Children's Grand Park Station (Line 7) and go straight 300m.
Squid fishing without words!
Children's Hall sledding range is 10,000 won and set ticket with smelt fishing experience is 15,000 won. Additional charges for Air Bumbercar (KRW 5,000), Euro address (KRW 5,000), and Viking (KRW 3000) are additional. It is open daily from 9:30 am to 5:00 pm, without opening. You must enter by no later than 4:00.
Freshly caught smelt can be fried immediately
There is also a gentle 80m course slope dedicated to children to prevent accidents. Mom and dad can use it with their children. There is also a sledding range for adults up to 120 meters in length, which is a great date course.
Freshly caught smelt can be fried immediately
Downtown night view is a bonus, Seoul Plaza Skating Rink
Seoul Square Skating Rink In winter, the plaza in front of the Seoul City Hall is reborn as an ice rink. It will be open until February 8, which will open on December 19. Hours are 10am to 9:30 pm (Sun-Thu) / 10am to 11pm (Saturday and Public Holidays).
The money needed to skate while enjoying the night view in the middle of downtown Seoul is 1,000 won. The price includes the skate rental fee. It will be open for 1 hour and then 30 minutes for maintenance from 10 am. 700 people each day. Internet and field booking are half and half. Skating on Namsan, you can decorate a date course where you can enjoy the night view. Enjoy it before winter
Seoul Square Skating Rink loved every winter

item.title: Frozen, Naesosa Temple in the White Snow
item.description:
Frozen, Naesosa Temple in the White Snow

Buan-gun, Jeonbuk, Korea

This Byeonsan Winter Travel Course is prepared with 'Naesosa-Gear Sosa Salt Paste', which binds inner and outer mountains at once. Not to mention the millennium consideration Nae Sosa, Gomso woven in one course, and decided to take a look at the salt pant. Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for a long time, in the West Sea, I will not be involved in the salting technique developed to eat abundant seafood for a long time. The winter Gomyeojeonjeon is a vivid landscape filled with ice snow glittering like salt instead of salt. If you add the quarry river and red river, the outland mountain is perfect for winter sea travel.

A trip to the West Sea, where you can see everything at sunrise and sunset, becomes even more abundant in winter. Is it thanks to the seasonal foods? Is it the power of white snow? One winter, during the heavy snowfall of the West Coast, I visited Buan Byeonsan Peninsula, the pearl of the West Sea. I missed the winter landscape of the Naesosa fir forest road and the arid seasons of the Reddish River and the Quarry River.

Dawn of Goat Salt Dishes
Buan Byeonsan Peninsula, Pearl of the West Sea
It's a winter torsion. A salt field, salted out as it is. Snowy salt fields resembling white salt are more serene and beautiful than you might think.
Salt storage for salt
In addition, if the day is clear, you can see the sunrise at Gomso Port.
Before dawn
The Saemangeum Public Relations Hall is the first to greet you when you enter Buan along Saemangeum Road.
Red wall named for proud scenery
Go up National Route 30 and look around the coast of Byeonsan Peninsula (outside Mt.) and go to Gomso Port or follow the Inner Mt.
The appearance changes depending on the water
Knowing when to bite makes it easier to make copper wires. Because quarrying and reddish rivers are different depending on the time of lifting.
Gyeokpo Beach seen from the top of the chicken

In other words, if it is time for water to fall into the quarry and red water rivers at the time of arrival, you can walk to Naesosa Temple or Gomso Port first. You can check the time at the Byeonsan Peninsula National Park website.

http://byeonsan.knps.or.kr/front/portal/visit/visitCourseMain.do?parkId=121800&menuNo=7020091

Gyeokpo Port, viewed from the top of Chicken Ebon (85m)
When the arrival time is high, stop by the Red Rock and Quarry River first. After eating, go up to Euibong Peak (85m) and look at Byeonsanji vegetation and Gappo Port at a glance.
Evening Gappo Beach with heavy snowfall
Then take National Route 30 and go counterclockwise to reach Gomso Port.
Road to Chicken Ebon (85m)
Wait here! Before you reach Gomso Port, remember the Jeonbuk Student Maritime Training Center located between Evergreen Beach and Mohang Beach. You can enjoy the wonderful fall falling into the sea against the backdrop of Sol Island.
Sol Island Sunset in front of Jeonbuk Student Maritime Training Center
If you want to shoot a good sunset, you should arrive and wait 30 minutes before sunset. If the time is not right, you can see Gomyeojeonjeon or Naesosa first.
Buan Bear Fire Hydrant Sunset
The reporter looked for Naso Sosa in anticipation of seeing the sunrise at Gomso Port. Naesosa is famous for cherry blossoms in spring and colored leaves in autumn. The winter scenery in the white snow does not fall out. If you find it right after the snow piled up would have encountered a more spectacular scenery.
Gappohang Sunset
A Millennial Consideration Meets the Fir Forest Path
According to records such as Dongguk Yeoji Seungram, Naesosa's original name was 'Sorae-sa (蘇 來 寺)'. It has been said that it was named “Naso” because the Chinese Tang Dynasty Chang-Sang Jeong-bang was established. After one week, the path leads to Cheonwangmun and a fir forest path that introduces Nao Sosa Temple, which is more than a thousand years old.
Naesosa
It's about 500m. If you reach the Cheonwangmun through the fir forest that is likely to lead to the Winter Kingdom, it is welcoming to Nasosa. Daewoong Preservation (Treasure No. 291), which appears to be brilliant, almost disappeared. There is a lack of testimonial data and it is preserved as it is without coloring. Along with Seonggyesa Temple, Silsangsa Temple and Changrimsa Temple, it was selected as the 4th largest temple in Byeonsan. Only Naesosa keeps its place for many years.
Seolseon-dang and Yosa reach through one order of Naesosa Temple
The flower pattern grate, which has been dull for the past year, is also eye-catching. At sunset, you can see the shadows of the flower-patterned grate with the red sun. Here is not the end. If you find Naesosa, let's go inside Daewoong Bojeon. There is a statue of White Kannon Bodhisattva on the wall behind the Buddhist altar. If you make an eye upon your eyes, your wish will come true.
Flower pattern grate of Naesosa Temple Daewoong Preservation
Yeongsanhoe Gwanbultang (Treasure No. 1268), Goryeo Dynasty (Treasure No. 277), and a legal book (Treasure No. 278) are also treasures of Naesosa. Due to the large number of external exhibitions, it is rare to be in Naesosa Temple.
Daewoong Preservation of Naesosa Temple
King's beloved salt, resurrected in the modern day salt-bearing salt

After exiting Naesosa, climb National Route 30 and you will soon reach Gomso. Gomso has been famous for salt pans since ancient times. Gyehwabeol was the main production area, but during World War II, it became a land by constructing roads and building dikes linking the interlocking villages with Hodo (Bumseom), Ungyeon Island, and Sokdo during the end of the Japanese War. As such, the 45 hectares of Gomin-so-jeon are located in Gomso Port. The annual salt production boasts 2500 tons. Let's take a quick look at the signboard at the beginning of Gom Gomin.

Gomso's specialty is salt. In the past, salt was so important that it was managed by the state and must not have been sold until recently. One of the things to take to the king's refuge was salt. While man is necessary to live… (syncopation)… The production of salt in Buan was mainly flame, and the area of Gyehwa Daeverly was the main production area. Gomso's good salt taste makes fermented foods such as Gomso Salted Fish, Soybean Soybean Paste, and Cinnamic Bamboo Salt, a specialty.

Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for many years

Gomson solar salt is produced from March to the end of October. You can get salt every summer and every 3 to 5 days in spring and autumn. Summer salt is large in crystals and small in crystals but hard in autumn. Gommon sun salt has little bitter taste because it is not used when the concentration of liver water becomes dark.

I found Gomso salt field before dawn. The snow is still piled up due to the heavy snow on the west coast, which has not yet wakened up from the dark. It is not cloudy and the sun does not appear. Instead, I could see the Gomyeojeonjeon waking up. Slowly dark goes Instead of salt, the snowflake sits on top of the salt pan and shines. Except for the winter, you can also enjoy the Gomyeo salt preservation experience.

Gomyeojeon, which has been famous for many years

item.title: Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty
item.description:
Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty

Wonju, Gangwon, South Korea

Wonju, the city you will meet when you run the Yeongdong Expressway towards the East Sea. I found hidden fun in Wonju, which I thought was a passing city. It is located in every corner of the Central Market. It is also fun to visit the Jungjung Traditional Market facing the Central Market and the Pungmul Market every 2 and 7 days. Loosen the belts when looking around the market.

Delicious and inexpensive, Wonju Central Market
If you're very hungry, or wondering about the most famous restaurant in the Central Market, don't wander and visit Wonju Kimchi Dumpling (033-745-3848). This dumpling house has been for three generations for over 40 years.
Wonju Kimchi dumplings
The family that runs dumplings in the face of the handicapped has become more famous as it is introduced in TV documentaries. Not to mention the taste of dumplings. The guests who filled the dining table reassure the first visitor.
The lady who was introduced to a TV program and became a celebrity
The representative menu of this house is Kalmandu. It is a hearty menu of kalguksu and dumplings. It's good to have your own kalguksu noodles, but the texture of dumplings with plenty of cabbage kimchi is incomparable to any other dumplings in other regions.
Kal dumplings to taste both kalguksu
If you want to taste the dumplings, order kimchi dumplings boiled in boiling water. The thick but chewy dumplings and the crispy dumplings are in harmony, so your hands keep going even though you are full.
Warm kimchi dumplings
Fried dumplings fried with freshly made dumplings are also special.
Crispy Fried Dumplings
Buckwheat jeon, which is made of thin buckwheat dough with Chinese cabbage and green onions, is a food often encountered while visiting Wonju's market. The buckwheat jeon, which can never be imitated without the grandmother's hands, is a taste of Gangwon-do, with a light taste and simple emotion.
Buckwheat noodle made with grandma's taste
The price is good with just 1,000 won for 2-3 pieces. Buckwheat Buckwheat (033-745-1644) is one of the most praised buckwheat collections.
Buckwheat jeon tasted in the rural marketplace of Gangwon-do becomes a memory
Many young people visit the Central Market because they are connected to the street of Jung-dong Culture called Myeong-dong. The free market next to the central market is a modern mall. If you go down to the first floor, there are small restaurants that sell Korean representative snacks, Tteokbokki, Tempura, and Sundae. There are restaurants in the form of seats, but there are signboards such as Friendship House, Tonere, and Friendly Tteokbokki.
Tteokbokki Town, B1, Free Market
If you order one serving, you can mix various tempura with Tteokbokki according to your taste. Soup with a piece of fish paste is a service. It is a spot where light students eat and chatter.
Tteokbokki and tempura mixed with spicy sauce
On the opposite side of the underground passage there was one restaurant waiting in line.
Entrance to 'Hard home wherever you find'
Does it mean that it is hard to find in the corner of the basement? Or does it mean that it's hard to find a restaurant like this? 'Hard home to find it' (033-745-0031) is a place where you can taste special cutlet. If you eat it with spicy rice balls or spicy rice balls or tteokbokki, it's a great meal. Pork cuts are ground twice a day and fried at the same time as the order. Kim Don is made of rice balls topped with neat pork cutlet and spicy kimchi toppings. You can have several different menus. Kodonburo is also a popular dish, with fried cheese and vegetables. The low price of less than 6,000 won is also attractive, but the interior of the café on the second floor of the attic is a great way to attract young people.
Pork cutlet and rice ball of 'Hard house to find no matter where you find'
On the other side of the passage is a snack shop, the newlyweds (033-745-8037). Here too, you should be prepared to wait in line at mealtime. Although it is famous for myeon, there are also a variety of meal menus such as dolsot bibimbap, omelet rice, and miscellaneous vegetables. The highest price is just 4,500 won. Don't doubt the taste.
Newlywed Couples Filled with Young Customers
Try a specialty hidden in a narrow alley, Jungwon Traditional Market
If you fill up your stomach and leave the Central Market, you will find the Jungwon Traditional Market. If the central market is the center of food, the Jungwon Traditional Market is lined with clothing and grocery stores, so it's easy to walk and watch.
Hanwoo Alley, which has been alive since late afternoon, is a spot in the Jungwon Traditional Market that everyone knows. After opening the door, there are about 10 restaurants lined up in a narrow alley where you can bump into the nose of someone coming out of the store. At first glance, it has a shabby appearance and few tables, but you need to make a reservation to settle down in the evening. It is popular because you can taste special parts such as Korean beef meat, insole meat at reasonable prices. It is a friendly alley where you can face a forehead on a small brazier and share a drink at a piece of meat.
Hanwoo Alley in Jungwon Traditional Market
If you step inside the Korean beef alley, you can taste the tadpoles. Corn paste, which has passed through a coarse sieve, is often introduced on TV as it falls into hot water and ripens into a tadpole.
Drain the water and put it in a jar
If you're curious about the taste, look for Grandmother's tadpole (033-743-6473). Season the tadpole noodles from the water with soy sauce and chopped kimchi with garnish. The sesame salt you put in to add sue adjusts to your taste.
'Grandmother tadpole' in the alley
In Wonju, it is not called tadpole noodles but tadpoles. The way of eating is similar to mukbap but does not use broth separately. Crunchy kimchi and soft ladle noodles are cool and light. If the weather gets cold, you can eat it warmly.
Tadpole noodles with kimchi garnish
The central passage is the alley. It is a place where you can taste all kinds of temples that are eaten during sacrifices and holidays.
'Delicacies' in Alleys
Meet every 5 days, the taste of Pungmul Market

If you find 2, 7 on the date you found Wonju, the visit to Pungmul Market is a bonus. You may plan a weekly outing on the day of the market. As Wonju was the largest market place in the Gangwon region, it is a market that inherits its traditions and gathers a variety of daily necessities including agricultural and marine products.

If you pass by today, let's meet the restaurants of Pungmul Market where you have to wait 5 days again. 'Jangterukbap' (033-734-7929) is a common restaurant that sells Sundae Gukbap and Kalguksu on days when there is no market, but it turns into a feast day after day. This is because buckwheat pancakes are made with buckwheat pancakes and mung bean pancakes. You can choose the food you want to eat in the restaurant.
Quail House, featuring food stalls
The quail-style “Quilt House” without a phone number grills various kinds of seafood such as squid, quails and skewers on a charcoal fire. Older seniors are hungry for simple snacks, but they offer a unique experience for travelers who go to oil field outings for unusual sights. It is also a tourist's privilege to take a leisurely tour of those who have gone out for shopping with a bowl of warm mussel bath.
Wholesale Shop Opening After Sale

item.title: Take the train, Chungju Samtan Amusement Park & Indeungsan
item.description:
Take the train, Chungju Samtan Amusement Park & Indeungsan

Chungju, Chungbuk, South Korea

Water play that reminds me of summer and water play in scenic nature is a fresh play. With the romantic romance of the train, the pleasure of traveling multiplies, regardless of time.
Samtan Station and Chungbuk Line Train
In front of the train station, Samtan Amusement Park where water, forest and mountains are combined. Camping is easy to leave, and it is easy to use the accommodations that are located next to the amusement park. It is also a good idea to have a regular mountain climbing mountain. On the way back, enjoy sightseeing near Chungju Station, and your trip will be more enriching. Let's leave by train, Chungju!
Jupocheon from the Samtan Bridge
Samtan Amusement Park by train track
Samtan Amusement Park is located at Sancheok-myeon, Chungju-si, Chungbuk. The train to Samtan Amusement Park is good. This is because there is an amusement park about 500 meters from Samtan Station. Pass the Samtan Bridge right in front of the station and follow the road to Myeongdol Village. Samtan means three streams, such as government office, pine and barnacle. Jupocheon, which leads to the Namhan River, flows around the amusement park.
Myeongdol Village Entrance Seats and Sports Park
In the past, the people were rare enough to stay with them, but in 1958 trains passing through Samtan Station were extended to form villages and amusement parks. In June 2000, a sports park was created next to the amusement park. Recently, a natural grass soccer field has been set up in the center of the park. Most of the facilities in the amusement park can be used free of charge, but lawn parks require a maintenance fee after booking.
Athletic Park
In addition to the turf field, the vacant lot can also be used as a camping ground. The large campsite makes it easy to find a place to go. There are also facilities such as toilet, drinking fountain and parking lot.
Jopocheon and amusement park gravel under the train tracks

The malls along the funfair ramp combine restaurants, canteens and bed and breakfasts. You can rent or buy some fishing gear as well as some simple fishing gear. Every summer, residents work together to improve the environment around the park. This year, from July 16th to August 15th, an environmental information center and Saemaul Library will be run by 200 residents. The Environmental Information Center is a voluntary activity that creates a clean environment for vacationers by removing garbage and collecting recyclables around the amusement park. Saemaul Library has over 2,000 books available for free rental and leads a healthy holiday culture. Residents in charge of the river reside in preparation for safety accidents.

Midsummer Willow

The amusement park is surrounded by mountains, and the odd rock cliffs are superbly located across the main stream. The river is wide and the water level is varied, so it is good for children to adults. Gravel fields spread out next to the sports park. There is a lush forest on top of it, and rich trees such as willows make the shade.

Amusement park next to sports park
Receive the energy of three
Indeungsan is a 667m high mountain located just behind the amusement park. It belongs to Cheondeungsan (807m) in the north and Jideungsan (535m) in the south, and belongs to Samdeungsan which means Cheon, Ji, and Injae. Sandeungsan is known for being sheltered from the mountains and deep in valleys. In addition, the legend is said that if one crosses all three mountains, one wish will be fulfilled.
Train passing railroad crossing by the amusement park
Cheondeungsan Mountain is named after the top of the mountain. The trail is not easy. Along with Bakdaljae, he became famous as a popular song <Crying Bakdaljae>, but in fact, about 9km away from Cheondeungsan and Wonseocheon, it belongs to Mt.
Samtan Amusement Park from the Beginning of the Trail
Jideung Mountain is a mountain that is connected to Indeung Mountain. In climbing is a mountain that can be climbed without difficulty. While walking to the summit, the scenery is beautiful, and on a good day, you can look down to Chungju Lake.
Forest road heading to the observatory
When the weather is too hot, it's a good idea to walk along the forest road to the observation deck.
Hiking trail by the valley
It is about 3km from Samtan Amusement Park to Observation Deck. Passing the mall opposite the amusement park leads you to the apple orchard. When you enter the road, you will be able to walk around the mountain. Do not enter the valley road, it is good to follow the road. There are no milestones on the mountain trail next to the valley, so you can wander around.
Observation Deck 700m
If you climb about 1.7km from the entrance, you will come to a three-way street. Follow the signs to the right for about 700m to reach the observatory. If you climb the observatory, you can see the Cheondeungsan Mountain opposite you and face the river flowing under the mountain.
The area of Jideungsan from the Cheonjiin Observatory
The train tracks seen from the mountain are also superb views.
Village seen from the observation deck
Chungju caliber on the way back

Before heading home, let's go from Samtan Station to Chungju Station in time for the train. Jungang Top Park is located about 7km from Chungju Station. It is called the tower in the center of Korea. Its historical name is Joongwon Papyeong-ri Seven-storied pagoda. It is the largest stone pagoda in the Unified Shilla Era. It is currently designated as National Treasure No. 6. In 1992, a historic park was built around the pagoda, and in 2007, the park facility was built along with the reorganization and repair work around the central pagoda. Inside the park are Chungju Museum 1 and 2, an open-air museum and a music hall. A music fountain is installed on Tangeum Lake in front of the park.

Next to the park is the World Liquor Museum. Visit the Wine History and Culture Museum for information about wine. There is also an experience facility where you can listen to the whiskey ripening process and taste the whiskey in oak barrels. A collection of beers, spirits, and oriental alcohol from around the world. The liquor of our country attracts people's attention by displaying traditional and modern wine more carefully. In addition to the exhibition halls, a separate education center will be operated and mainstream culture and fermentation science experiences will be conducted. Anyone can join in advance.
Jungwon Tappyeong Seven-storied Pagoda in Jungang Pagoda Park
There are many charming restaurants around the museum. Next door is Tangeumho International Rowing Center. Tangeum Lake was formed during the construction of Chungju Dam in 1985. Until 2004, the stadium was used as a water sports park for the general public and as a training ground for rowers. In summer, the Chungju Lake Festival is held in this area, and water sports activities are free for the general public.
Museum of World Liquor Culture

item.title: Camper misses island 'Shinan Amtaedo Mongdol Sea Campground'
item.description:
Camper misses island 'Shinan Amtaedo Mongdol Sea Campground'

Sinan-gun, Jeonnam, Korea

Summer is crowded with people everywhere. If you're looking for a camping spot to enjoy the summer, head to the island. A day of bathing on a secluded beach, picking up seashells, walking and paddling, and falling asleep in the sound of calm waves. And when you open your eyes until the morning when the blue sea is full of tents… . The summer you dream is there.

Mongdol Sea Campground overflowing with blue sea
Fluttering on board a tent
Sinan is a country on the island. The island is composed of 1,004 islands, including 72 manned islands and 932 uninhabited islands. Among the countless islands as the stars in the night sky, the dark attitude is attracting attention among campers. This is because the Mongdol Sea Campground, which is popular with camping families, is located on the island.
Mongdol Sea Campground is different from the journey. First, put a tent and body on the boat. And he goes through the scenery of the archipelago. Even if you are overwhelmed, you will leave the Songgong Dock and travel for about 25 minutes. 5 minutes drive from the marina to the camping grounds. Along the way, the landscape of the nostalgic island spreads out. It is accompanied by a salt field with the sun's passion and a tidal flat engraved with an S-shaped waterway. Beyond the salt fields and tidal flats, these islands cast shadows.
Carry a tent and a body and go through the landscape
‘夢 -bar’ campsite telling dreams
Mongdol Sea Campground is set on a hill leading to the beach. The cascading site on a steep hill overlooks the sea. Against the sea, I can't wait to play tents.
Overlooking Mongdol Beach is a camping beach
The island had a thousand faces. 365 days of changeable island weather offers a different landscape every day. Ocean view of Mongdol Sea Campground is nothing to be bored during your stay. The ocean view of an expensive hotel is not envious.
Happy to wash dishes at Mongdol Sea Campground
The Mongdol Beach overlooking the tent is a private camping beach. Even if the 24 sites of the campsite are full, the beaches are generous.
An ocean view no less expensive than a hotel
The fun is endless. Rias beaches are safe and enjoyable beaches. The drained and exposed tidal flats are transformed into ecological experience sites. Sea crabs, shellfish and fry fill the tidal flats. When you play with her, your whole body will improve with a natural mud pack.
Sora is a fist
Between the drained and exposed tidal stones, the seashells with only bumps and knuckles are the best. It's fun to catch, but the taste of boiled beef and seashells is also good.
Living Eco Experience Center
The offshore campsite is a fishing spot. Various fish are caught depending on the season such as black sea bream, rockfish and conger eel. That's why fishing camping enthusiasts line up.
Living Eco Experience Center
The Mongdol Sea Campground opened in 2012 and is celebrating its third year. Captain Choi Myung-sin wandered around the country for a year in search of a camping site and met there. It was the place where my son and I sketched and dreamed.
“夢 -bar” campsite for dreamers
The Mongdol Sea Campground is more commonly referred to as the "Monba". Mongba is also a short word for Mongdolsea, but it is a compound word of dream “mont” and the adverb “bar” which means “can” in German. In other words, “夢 bar” means you can dream. It is a camping ground where people dream and they want to be a camping ground where people can design their dreams and go back.
Beautiful Mongdol Beach
Evening sunsets at Mongdol Beach are sweet as dreams. You fall asleep with the gentle sound of the waves, and when you open your eyes, the sea flows in front of the tent. The laughter of the children spreads like the sun.
Evening sweet sunset
Happiness to enjoy four islands at once
Dark attitude is also the starting point for island trips. Four islands are connected by bridges: Amtaedo, Jaeundo, Palgeumdo, and Anzado. You can enjoy all these islands by boat. Crossing Eunam Bridge is Jaeundo. Jaeundo, which means “kind and gracious,” has picturesque beaches running along the island. Particularly popular are the sloping beaches with gentle slopes, lush pine forests, white sandy beaches with white sand beaches, and dune villages where you can experience lily digging and frying nets.
Amtaedo finds a lot of Chupo beach. The 2.5km outcrop that appears at low tide is a landmark of Chupo. Both sides run out of the outcrop. Crossing Jungang Bridge to the south from Amtaedo leads to Palgumdo. There is a three story stone pagoda at the entrance of Eupri village, located in Palgeum-myeon. It is believed to be a pagoda of the Koryo Dynasty, and a small island is approaching greatly in the face of more than a thousand years.
Kim Hwan-ki's Birthplace
Andzado Island, located at the bottom, is the most hidden area of the four islands. Kim Hwan-ki, called “Picasso of Korea,” was born and raised here. His birthplace is in Eupdong-ri, where his childhood memories of nourishing his work are difficult. In Bangwol-ri, there is a dolmen, a bronze age tomb. Beyond the dolmen, the village stone path naturally follows.
Bangwol-ri Dolmen
The beauty of Anzado is “Angel's Bridge. Anzad is also a bridge between Park Do-do and Banwol-do. It is 1,462 meters long. Walking on the bridge makes you feel like you're walking on the sea. It is good to see sunrise and sunrise.
Sights of Anzado, Angel's Bridge

The boat going to Amtaedo operates from 7:00 am to 7:50 pm every hour. If you take a car with you, line up the car first, following the sign for Amtaedo, and call the car number to go to the ticket. You must bring your ID. If you have a lot of cars to board, you have to wait a few hours, so it is best to use the boat early. The fare is 3,300 won each way, and the fare for passenger cars is 15,000 won (inquiry: Sinan Agricultural Cooperative Ticket Office 061-271-0090). Currently, a new millennium bridge that connects Abroad and Amtaedo is under construction to be completed in 2018.

Another nostalgic island scenery
Travel info

Mongdol Sea Campground

Contact: 061-262-8872

www.bada-camp.com

item.title: Autumn trip to Gokseong with the last string of the Seomjin River
item.description:
Autumn trip to Gokseong with the last string of the Seomjin River

Gokseong-gun, Jeonnam, Korea

The mother told her that she grew up in a village with watermelon-flavored fish. The child he wants to see goes to his mother's home in search of his mother's home. Climb a small boat and cross the clear, calm stream. And beside him is a man who misses her as much as a child. The love story of a man who has a knife with his wounded heart and a woman who loved him began with the filming site of KBS drama Iron Man, Gokseong Seomjin River.

What is love? How long has humanity wandered in search of “it” that is invisible and untouched? Doesn't everyone have their own love. Here is a man trapped in a long love. Hong Bin (Lee Dong-wook) is the hero of the drama <Iron Man> on KBS-2TV. Hongbin is having a long time with Kim Tae-hee (Han Eun-jung), the daughter of a stationery shop who first met her. We are still waiting for our first love, whose life and death are unknown. Then one day, a spear appears in front of him called Taehee. Hong Bin, who didn't even know the life of his first love, leaves with his son, Chang, to the hometown of Tae-hee, whose fish smells like watermelon. Oji village in Seomjin river and Jirisan, Gokseong, Jeonnam.

Seojinjin River's last boat
Gokseong, a valley village in Seomjin and Boseong
Gokseong with Seomjin River and Jirisan Mountain. The tea comes from the name 'Valley' village. In fact, Gokseong is a mountain village with stems of Seomjin and Boseong rivers. Due to this natural condition, Gokseong, which was considered as an underdeveloped area, began to emerge as a tourist attraction because of the nature, Seomjin and Boseong rivers. In addition, 'Gokseong Seomjin River Train Village' and 'Sumjin River Rail Bike', which were made by utilizing the Jeolla Line, which was closed, added explosive power.
The reason why I found the song this time was to meet Seomjin River Joolbae in the drama. Was it because of the dignity of the scene of crossing the river that was spraying and visiting Taehee's hometown of first love? Thanks to some hints from the drama, the place was reduced to Seomjin River. In addition, Seomjin river rope boat was only difficult to find because it remained only in Gokseong.
Seomjin River wets calm water and Hunan
The rope boat, as its name implies, is a boat that crosses both sides of the river and pulls the rope. Expectations were added that if it was a deep mountainous area where you could rely on a ropeboat instead of overflowing tourist spots and overflowing people, you could rest there. Seomjin River rope boat connects Seokjin Village and Hogok Village with a stream of water in between.
Steam locomotive from Seomjin River Train Village
Life of Hogok Village, Seomjin River
The last rope of Seomjin River. What a fascinating name for an outsider. If you go down Seomjin River from Seokgok Village bus stop, you will see Hogok Naruto. When traveling by car, you can type ‘slump garden’ into the navigation, park it on the ground and cross the street. You will see the bus stop right away. If you go down the river, a rope boat, which was not visible on Route 17, will appear 'salt'.
Journey to the Hoegoru
To go to the village across the river, go to Dugok Bridge to the south and Pong Pong Bridge to the north. If you own a car, it will save you some time, but nothing can follow you. It takes more than an hour to cross the bridge from Hogok Village and cross the bridge along the 9th province road to the Seokjeong Village bus stop.
Journey to the Hoegoru
For the villagers of Hogok village, the worship is life. It is really useful to reach the bus stop just across the river by boat. Wait a minute here, and wonder why the only ropeboat left on the stem of Seomjin River, which is over 500 Li, remains here in Gokseong. Simple. Gokseong itself is a valley surrounded by Seomjin River, Boseong River, and Jirisan Mountain, and Hogok Village, located across from Seomjin River, is a real Oji village. There were also fewer residents, so there were no bridges, and a real life rope was left.
I see a rope that was invisible on Route 17.
It is a definite clue that the outsiders feel pitiful and lyrical to the river trunks, but it shows the poor life to the residents here. If you're across the street, don't worry. If you pull the line, the ship comes across alone.
I see a rope that was invisible on Route 17.
Gokseong travel point, Seomjin River train carrying love
Now that you've watched the ropes, let's look around the stems of Seomjin River. At Seokchi Station, you can enjoy rail bikes using the closed section of Jeolla Line. A rail extends along the stem of Seomjin River. It is more popular with young people because it can see the bare skin of Seomjin River more dynamically.
Seomjin River train village built in old Gokseong station
If you are concerned about UV and leg muscles, head to the Seomjin River train village between Gokseong Station and Home Station and get on a steam locomotive. A Sekan steam locomotive that runs on Jeolla Line, which is not currently operated, runs along Seomjin River.
Memories snacks sold on steam locomotives are popular
The summit of the Seomjin River spreading out of the window is the best. When you get on the train, a brief commentary also adds fun to me.
Memories snacks sold on steam locomotives are popular
If you want to use both Seomjin River Rail Bike and Seomjin River Steam Locomotive at once, take a steam locomotive at Gokseong Station or Home Station and get off at Seokgok Station. Seomjin River rail bike runs from Seokgok Station.
View from the steam locomotive
One more thing, if you want to go to Seokjin on weekends, if you want to enjoy the Seomjin River train and rail bike, you can make a reservation online. The Seomjin River train village, which is also considered as the “Star of Korea Tourism,” is visited by many.
View from the steam locomotive
Don't miss the rose park of Gokseong Station Seomjin-ga Train Village. There is a separate entrance fee for the train village (3000 won). You need an admission ticket for a train village to go into Gokseong Station and book tickets for Gokseong ~ Home round trip.
Seomjin River Rock Bridge
The seats are divided into mountain scenery and strong scenery, but for subway type seats, you need to reserve the scenery for the mountain scenery side and general train type seats to look around Seomjin River.
Sumjin River from the Seomjin River Rock Bridge
If you are departing from Gokseong station, give yourself 30 minutes at home station. The round trip takes about two hours.
You can see the river stream through the transparent window on the bridge.
When you get off at home station, Seomjin River spreads out in front of you. Gokseong County Youth Camp and Seomjin River Observatory are visible from Seomjin River Rock Bridge. Seomjin River is full of autumn sun.
I can see a train running to Gokseong Station
If you plan to stay for more than 1 night in Gokseong, you can stay in the campsite or in the Simcheok Hanok Village located in the vicinity. It tells the story of Gokseong, which is considered as the source of the deep blue narrative. You can experience Hanok at an affordable price.
Seomjin River Train Village has a rose park and amusement park
If you want to stay a little bit different, you can choose train pensions near the home station or rail pensions near Gokseong station. Gokseong has plenty of accommodation for families. Who hit the spring Sumjin River the best? The dim autumn Seomjin River is no less.
Seomjin River Train Village has a rose park and amusement park
tip. Seomjin River Train Village

Once you enter Seomjin River Train Village (former Gokseong Station), you can buy a steam locomotive. You will need to purchase a train village ticket and a steam locomotive boarding pass respectively. If you get on the steam locomotive between the old Gokseong station and home station (about 10km), the Seomjin River train journey begins. The bus stops for about 30 minutes and returns to Gokseong Station. It operates five times a day, seven days a week (departing from train village 09:30, 11:30, 13:30, 15:30, 17:30). During the low season, the first time (09:30) and the last time (17:30) are not operated. 80 minutes round trip, 370 passengers. All online booking

http://ticket.gstrain.co.kr/tickets/

It is possible. Tickets for the Seomjin River Train Village are 3,000 won for the peak season (April to October), 2,500 won for the Soin & Gyeonggi University, and 1,000 won each for the low season (November to March). Call 061-362-8635 for admission tickets. Seats for steam locomotives are 6,000 won for round trips and 4000 won for one-way trips. Standing is 5000 won round trip and 3500 won one way.

http://www.gstrain.co.kr/

item.title: The drama “Discovery of Love.” The space where their love began, Jinju Station & Yeonhwado
item.description:
The drama “Discovery of Love.” The space where their love began, Jinju Station & Yeonhwado

Tongyeong, Gyeongnam, Korea

Every time I watched, I walked along the summer and Taeha, the protagonist of KBS 2TV's <Discovery of Love>, who hits his knees “tak”. The coincidence on the train to Jinju, where they first met, sublimates to fate along the summer courageous softening. Both places and opponents were different, but with a dim first love that had nothing in common, they headed for Jinju Station and Yeonhwa-do.

Here is a woman. Her name is midsummer. Now there are two men by her side. One is the current man Nam Ha-jin, and the other is the man of the past. The 32-year-old furniture designer, summer, is now in her second year of love with Plastic Surgeon Hajin, the same age. Friendly and competent. In addition, there is a boyfriend who matches, understands and loses much in summer. One day, a happy day that seems to last forever, a man of the past, Kang Tae-ha, appears in front of them.

Dongdu Village as seen from Yeonhwado Bridge
Autumn trip to find love story in drama
This is the stem of the drama <Discovery of Love> on KBS 2TV. Why do you need to know this? That's because Summer, the protagonist of <Discovery of Love>, will meet Tae-ha and introduce a space that fell in love like fate, aka the Holy Land of Love.
Summer and Taeha, the protagonist of 'Discovery of Love'
This season, when people miss their warmth, they followed their love story, remembering when they whispered in their hands, looking into each other's eyes, which would certainly occupy the corner of everybody's heart. Introducing the autumn trip that would be better with the person next door.
Summer and Taeha, the protagonist of 'Discovery of Love'
The train to Jinju, where the protagonist of <Discovery of Love> summer and Taeha met for the first time. Met in an old fashioned or destiny, they fell in love so much. Kang, he was the first love of summer. It's fresh when you don't know what to do. That's why the first love that can only hurt and hurt more. At the border between a child and an adult, they begin with a summer jigsaw that "I feel in love with you now." Xue Lei temporarily ends their first meeting at Jinju Station, their destination. With the words of Tae-ha, "Go to Yeonhwado".
Summer and Taeha, the protagonist of 'Discovery of Love'
Jinju Station, which was introduced in the drama, is not the same place as Jinju Station 5 years ago. The current Jinju Station is the new Jinju Station, which was newly established in Gajwa-dong in 2012. So, in the context of the drama, they first met Jinju Station in Gangnam-dong.
Jinju Station
Opened in 1925, it has been lost and completed. The former Jinju Station, which stopped operating Saemaul Lake the following year, was suspended in 2006. It has been opened since the Saemaul Lake resumed operation with the stop of KTX.
Jinju Station
Once upon a time there is a restaurant. The front is a restaurant, but when you go back, you still have a "pearl" sign. The lapse of the disappeared railroad runs through the cosmos. Bullet-printed bullets carved out of the neglected Jinju Station Car Maintenance Warehouse (Registration No. 202) tell the past.
Old Jinju Station. There is a restaurant now.
The train bearing Jinju Station is a light line. It connects Gyeongsang-do and Jeolla-do, and became the 'Gyeongjeon Line' after the first letter. During the Japanese colonial period, rice and cotton were brought to Japan to connect Honam and Yeongnam granary and Busan. The earliest Gyeongjeon Line, which connected Jinju ~ Jeonju, Wonchon ~ Damyang, currently connects Samyangjin Station in Milyang, Gyeongnam and Songjeong Station in Gwangju. Jinju has long been a hub for inland traffic.
Old Jinju Station. There is a restaurant now.
150li according to love, from Jinju station to Tongyeong

It has the same name 'Jinju Station' but one is abandoned and the other is open. Maybe it resembles love. The only indication that this station was a station is the Jinju station sign, the faint train tracks, and the Jinju station car maintenance. Head to Tongyeong from Jinju Station, where only the trail remains. To meet Taeha again, head back to Yeonhwa-do along the back of Spiral Summer.

Passenger ship connecting Yeonhwa ~ Yangji at Tongyeong Passenger Terminal

If you look at the drama, you know that Jinju Station and Yeonhwado are very close, but there is actually quite a distance. It is about 60km by road from Jinju Station to Tongyeong Passenger Terminal. Where is it? It takes about 1 hour by boat from Tongyeong Passenger Terminal to reach Yeonhwa-do. It takes 55 minutes by car and about 1 hour and 10 minutes by public transport. To get to Tongyeong from Jinju, you have to travel from Jinju Station to Intercity Bus Terminal. Note that you can't board a Yeonhwado boat directly from Jinju Station. If you go to Jinju station after watching the drama, you should go to Intercity Bus Terminal again and go to Tongyeong Bus Terminal.

Yeonhwado arrives along the boat for about an hour
Soft island, lotus-like island in the sea
Running with the intention of seeing the man who fell in love at first sight again. To get to Yeonhwa-do, you have to go to the Tongyeong Passenger Ship Terminal, located across from Seoho Market. Depart from Tongyeong 5 times a day (06:30, 09:30, 11:00, 13:00, 15:00). However, ship times may change depending on the weather, so check in advance.
Softening degree entrance
Run for about an hour to reach softening. Stopped at Yeonhwa Island for a while, so you should get off well. The ship that went to Yogyakdo stops at Yeonhwado Island and goes out.
Yeonjiwon Wonrang Elementary School
Yeonhwado, a legendary missionary and legend, is a small island. It is divided into two courses. One is the A course (3 hours) to the passenger ship terminal ~ Yeonhwabong ~ Bodeokam ~ Hung bridge ~ Dragon head ~ Passenger ship terminal; Connected course B (2 hours). You can drive a car except for part of the B course.
Yeonhwasa Temple of Yeonhwado, a legend of mission
Softened ships can be shipped by car. It's a good island to walk around without any problem, but if you're accompanied by seniors, it's better to bring a car. This is because there is no taxi or bus in small Yeonhwa-do.
end
The friends who accompanied her missed the ship, but in summer, they just came to Yeonhwado in search of Kang Tae-ha, who fell in love at first sight.
Bodeokam and Crossroads
Calm island Yeondo Island possessed by Tongyeong Yokji. The two travel around Yeonhwa Island, seeing each other's feelings for each other and becoming lovers.
A road from a crossroad to a bridge
Their hearts begin in every corner of the island of Yeonhwado Island, including a rocky bridge that makes fun of summer, a shop that buys cup ramen by scooping up the remaining coins, an elementary school that stays overnight, delicious sashimi, and beautiful fall.
Tae-ha's teasing summer
Unfortunately, the water they used to eat is now out of season. <The discovery of love> The boss of the restaurant who filmed the picture of the reef, "The reef is out of season and mackerel in the fall," he recommends new food. Mackerel, which has a softening degree, is very delicious. If you have time, you can enjoy fishing.
The shop where cup ramen was bought in summer. Only super soft
Summer and taiji, they all disappeared. Love in the drama is also making knots, and the 16-part drama has come to an end. However, the space where their love started beating people's hearts one day when autumn began, and the uphill road where summer followed hardly all the way, and the rocky bridge where Taeha scared summer are also in place. It was a long way to come to see the beginning of the romance of the drama. Wasn't it because of the steadfastness or dimness of the unsightly things that Orot kept in place even after all the things that had once shone disappeared.
Softened mackerel, the best mackerel in autumn
Softening
Departs from Tongyeong Passenger Terminal 5 times daily (06:50, 09:30, 11:00, 13:00, 15:00). Departures 5 times a day from Yeonhwa Island (08:30, 11:45, 13:20, 15:30, 17:00). item.title: 4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events
item.description:
4.5 billion Asian festivals! Compete for over 3000 medals in 36 events

Seo-gu, Incheon, South Korea

On September 19, the 17th Incheon Asian Games started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium in Incheon, Korea. 45 Asian countries, including Korea, China, and Japan, compete for over 3000 medals in 36 sports (28 Olympics and 8 Olympics) including basketball, rugby, archery, weightlifting, swimming, canoeing and boxing. The event, which includes all members of the Asian Olympic Council (OCA), including North Korea, will be held for 16 days until October 4. The third Asian Games to be held in Korea is the third after Seoul in 1986 and Busan in 2002. As of 2014, only Thailand (4) and South Korea have hosted more than three Asian Games.

Opening ceremony of the 17th Incheon Asian Games
Departure begins at the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium on September 19, 2014
Before looking at the full schedule, let's take a look at the Incheon Asiad Main Stadium, which was completed for the Incheon Asian Games. It boasts a floor area of 11,620m2 (approximately 34,000 pyeong) and five floors and more than 60,000 seats. The competition started with the opening ceremony of Incheon Asiad Main Stadium. It is held in Incheon and Suwon Gymnasium (Handball), Munhak Park Tae-hwan Swimming Pool (Swimming). If you're a sports fan, it's a good idea to check the location of the stadium to create a line.
Opening Ceremony of 2014 Incheon Asian Games
A game of over 3000 medals. How should we look? Since we cannot introduce all the schedules, we arranged the schedules focusing on handball, swimming, archery, and gymnastics games loved by Koreans, mainly soccer, baseball, and basketball.
Opening Torch Light

First of all, the soccer became fun until the 2002 Korea-Japan World Cup. The final will take place at the Literature Stadium on October 2. In the soccer qualifiers held on September 21st, the Korean men's team beat Laos 2-0 and the women's team beat Maldives 13-0. Baseball, which started on the 22nd, won 15-0 against Thailand. The semi-finals and finals will take place on the 27th and 28th after the match against Hong Kong on the 24th. All take place at the Literary Baseball Stadium. Basketball is scheduled to play against Jordan at the Samsan World Gymnasium on the 25th. On the 28th, the quarter finals will be held at the Hwaseong Stadium.

Kim Young-Soo Chairman, Organizing Committee, Asian Games
Match schedule? It's not difficult!

Marine Boy Park Tae-hwan's swimming game is not to be missed. On the 21st, they won bronze medals in the men's freestyle 200m final and the men's freestyle 400m final on the 23rd. The freestyle 100m preliminaries are scheduled for 9 am on the 25th.

Gymnastics Fairy Son Yeon-jae will compete in the rhythmic gymnastics individual qualifiers on October 1 at Namdong Gymnasium. The rhythmic gymnastics consists of four events: ribbon, ball, club and hoop. There was a medal in gymnastics. On the 23rd, Lee Sang-wook won the bronze medal in the Men's Gymnastics Men's Final, and Yun Na-rae added another bronze medal in the Women's Individual Final. On the 24th, Yang Hak-sun will play in the final match of the gymnastics men's floor exercise, and will play against Li Segwang of North Korea. Gymnastics is the exercise of postponing body movements using machines. Express stability, difficulty, elegance and originality. Men's sports are Maru, Cheolbong, Parallel Bar, Massage, Ring, Chopping Board, and Women's Floor, Average Bar, Double Parallel Bar, Chopping Board.
Traditional medallion archery. The Republic of Korea breathes on a single arrow that cuts off the target. Archery won eight gold medals, including the 2014 Incheon Asian Games and the newly added compound. In the men's group qualification round (compound) held on the 23rd, Choi Yong-hee (2nd) and Yang Young-ho (5th) played in the men's individual qualification round. The women's team also took first place in the Compound Women's Qualifying Round and Choi Bo-min (1st) and Seok Ji-hyun (2nd) in the individual qualification round. The game is played every day until the 28th.
Wait here! There are two types of archery: a recurve bow and a compound bow. All archery we have seen in the meantime is recurve. Compound archery hasn't been an Olympic or Asian competition. However, attention has been increasing as it was adopted as a regular sport since the Incheon Asian Games. What is the difference between the two? As the name implies, the bow structure is different. If the recurve is a traditional bow, the compound is a mechanical bow. The recurve is heavy and sensitive, so the player's concentration is important. Thinking of the archery field in the meantime makes it easier to understand. Compounds, on the other hand, are lighter and smaller than mechanical arrowhead recurve arrows that are easy to learn for beginners with pulleys and sights.
In the finals of the badminton men's team where the opposition hero Lee Yong-dae played on the 23rd, he added a gold medal. The men's and women's mixed singles and doubles games will be held until the 29th. In addition, medal competitions will be held in 36 events including judo, shooting, cycling, and land. As of September 24, 2014, South Korea is ranked second overall with 61 medals, including 20 gold, 19 silver and 22 bronze.
Judo Qualification
Indeed, don't forget the seal of three children, Vichuon, Barame, and Chumyeon, the mascots of the Incheon Asian Games. The mascot of the convention has influenced the image of the competition. As the name suggests, the eldest son of the Incheon Asian Games, Bichuon, is, as the name suggests, 'the messenger of light shining hope on the whole world'. Was taken from. Why don't you enjoy the festival of autumn, wind, light and wind?
Panoramic view of Literary Park Tae Hwan Swimming Pool

item.title: Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour
item.description:
Hannam-dong Back Alley Tour

Yongsan-gu, Seoul, Korea

'Usadan-ro 10-gil', once located in Itaewon, once called the Liberation Village, has once again attracted the attention of the world. On the last Saturday of every month, we will visit the 10th Usadan-ro, Hannam-dong, a “warm town” in Seoul, which is being transformed into a forward base for small-business start-up as well as a space for artistic creation for young people.

Hannam-dong Back Alley Travel Map
Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro 10-gil, a young base for convergence and convergence of youth
Hansa-dong's Usadan-ro is less than 900 meters from Bogwang Elementary School to Cheongseok Super. Exit No. 3 of Itaewon Station (Line 6) and go up 100 meters to the '119 Safety Center' alley. Looking up from here, you can see two towers towering towards the sky. 'Seoul Central Masjid'. In front of the main entrance to the Islamic Masjid, the road that stretches in the direction of the Han River is Usadan.
Daytime in the Islamic Central Member of Seoul
If there were a lot of pear trees and it was called 'Itaewon (梨 泰 院)', 'Usadan-ro' came from the record that the altar 'Usadan' was built here for the rain festival during Taejong, Joseon Dynasty. Usadan-ro 10-gil is a favorite place for photographers because of the interruption of the redevelopment project. Let's take a look at what's going on.
Seoul Islamic Central Masquerade Night
It's hard to find an alley where Shingu is harmonious, like Usadan-ro 10-gil from Seoul.
Hanjin Barber Shop
From old-fashioned barbershops that use firewood as fuel, to radio stations, rice cakes, Pakistani and Turkish restaurants, the traditional market blends together, and the guest house, as well as a jewelry design shop using the latest technology.
50-year-old Barber Chair at Hanjin Barber Shop
Walking along this road, there are so many foreigners that I wonder if there are more foreigners than Koreans.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Not only the geographical features of Itaewon and Islam mosques, but also because of the old houses, the rent is cheap and the language and living environment are convenient.
Kebab restaurant transformed in mutt PC room
Itaewon's famous staircase and “Come in store”
Here is a community that drives young desires and change. The young cultural artists 'Usadandan (雩 祀 壇 團)' combines interesting cultural contents and business with the young people traders. Since 2012, young people who live in the area and have business spaces such as workshops have been working together to create local culture and revitalize their business.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The most representative business is the free market called 'stair leader'. The staircase, which started on 63 steps next to a mosque last spring, has only 30 to 40 participants, but now it has become one of the representative flea markets in Seoul.
Stairs next to the central Islamic mosque where the staircase was held
The stairs are open from 12 am to 6 am on the last Saturday of every month.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
It was originally held on 63 steps, less than 3 meters wide. Sellers can be assigned three stairs to sell.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
However, for the safety and convenience of many visitors to the stairs, the place is moved to 'Usadan-ro 10-gil'.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
The 'coming shops' with the catch phrase 'Come in because it's hot' on both sides of the street, and the temporary seller table installed in front of it, replace the stairs.
Street scene of Usadan-ro, where the staircases come in
One of the popular programs of 'Staircase-In Come' is 'Tongtong Tour', which explores local culture.
Plump Tour
You will wander through the alley for two hours and hear interesting stories about the history and culture of the area.
Tattoo drawing
The tour program, which starts at the central mosque and ends at the supermarket, is conducted by young local residents.
Seller's homemade basil pesto
As with any flea market, the most popular places are the gourmet foods, tattoo houses, and portrait shops, where you can draw a portrait in 10 seconds for 10 won.
Portrait that draws in 10 seconds for 10 won
Usadan-ro 10-gil, Itaewon, transforming into an artist studio and cultural spot
There are a growing number of shops on Usadan-gil, with unique attractions run by young Soho entrepreneurs and artists.
Suine's Snack Store Famous for Spicy Chicken Feet
In particular, the Potato House, which is run by youth traders, sells the popular concept of Potato and Beer.
A young merchant who is good at Sabah
In addition to trendy foods such as meals and snacks for lunch and dinner in the evenings, Sooky's Snack Shop, a spicy chicken restaurant popular with famous celebrities, is whether it's a snack bar or a bar. It's weird.
Sophisticated Yukgaejang
Chicken shops such as Song Elim Chicken, which are commonly found in the traditional world of 'Eating My World', offer chefs' menus that change every day.
Deep-fried brown chicken
There are a variety of cafes on Usadan-gil.
coffee
There are cafes in various forms, ranging from “today's opening” to “entropy” reminiscent of the laws of physics and “champs” reminiscent of boxing films.
Entropy
Champ is a roasting café operated by three brothers and made freshly roasted coffee beans to become a favorite coffee shop not only for the elderly, but also for young people. Down. 10 minutes patiently wait.
Champ Coffee
'It would have opened today' is a free-spirited cafe that the owner wants to open, but now it is open every day except Sundays.
I would have opened today
There are designer jewelery shops on both sides of the street, opened by young people with both dexterity and sense.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Young designers and makers work together to produce and display jewelry, bags, and accessories, which are made by giving off artistic artists.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
Typical shops include MK Leather Work (handmade leather bracelet), 'World I live' (handmade metal workshop), 'Mind Mine' (design jewelry), 'Luciente' (homemade jewelry), Ampersand (classic leather accessory), ' Thy '(leather wallet, wooden glasses, watch),' The 7th Heaven '(silverwork),' J & J Works' (jeans recycling accessory), and Xia's emotional doll.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
They create beautiful props that bring youth and run experience classes.
Designer Jewelry Products on Usadan-ro 10-gil
In addition, 'WORKS', which commissions and sells works produced by independent designers, 'Soul Ink', which combines an art tattoo shop and a graffiti exhibition hall, 'Kiss Gallery' with three works and a bench for viewing outside the window, Don't forget 'Art Recipe'.
Kiss pics
HAUS, a guest house for travelers, not only accepts guests in three rooms with bunk beds, but also serves as a local tourist information center and love room.
Guest House Haus
Tiger House has a well-viewed guest house famous for its bare tacos and polar beer.
Tiger House
Usadan-ro 10-gil ending at Dokkaebi Market and Supermarket
Entering the 'Dokkaebi Market', the road is divided into two parts. On the right side is the 'Cheongseok Super', the end of 10 roads in Usadan-ro. Follow the road on your left to 'Supermarket'. 'Supermarket' is a three-story building that is used as a café, small gatherings, parties, and dining venues by renovating an existing building.
Supermarket cafe
'Dokkaebi market' is a traditional market. When the crackdown of the ward office comes, it avoids it like a goblin.
Han River catches a glance at rooftop table

The characteristic of the shops that entered Usadanro is the creative space that made the old buildings with minimal remodeling. So some shops use old signs to confuse visitors. Nevertheless, due to the affection and passion of young artists and entrepreneurs, Usadan Street, which can turn into an unsafe crime alley, is transformed into an art creative street, and the streets of young people representing Seoul following Hongdae, Garosu-gil, etc. It is transformed into.

Dokebi Market
P.S.

On the late evening of Wednesday, four days after the staircase-incoming ceremony was held, I went back to the street. It's nine o'clock, and people are cut off and most shops are closed. English phrases written on the glass window reflecting the appearance of a few young people busy preparing to open a design office called “P.S.” touch the chest. “People all have names. Sometimes, things name people. We name things that already have names. Now, this could be the only name. ” “A person has a name, and sometimes things name a person. Even when there is a name for things, people call it again. ” In addition, I remember the title of poet Lee Kyung-ok's collection of poetry `` Road makes a way by walking. '' I wonder if we should walk on Usadan Road and call out its name to create the Usadan Street that young people dream of. And wishes.

Travel info

item.title: The main hub of maritime traffic between Japan and China in the Silla era
item.description:
The main hub of maritime traffic between Japan and China in the Silla era

Wando-gun, Jeonnam, Korea

Wando-gun. Is it because the island contains ‘島’. Wando is more popular with his islands than the main island itself. It's easy to think of Slow City's Cheongsan-do and Bogil-do, which bears alpine Yun Sun-do. To enter these two islands, you have to board a boat from Wando or the neighboring town of Haenam. As a result, even though they traveled to Wando, it is not uncommon for them to travel to the main island of Wando. That doesn't mean there's nothing to see on Wando Island. So today I prepared a round trip to Wando main island.

Crossing Wando Bridge from Haenam and entering Wando land, it is Wando-eup. The Shinji Bridge, which connects Wando-eup and Sinjido, can be reached by road to Sinjido. Aiming to be completed in 2015, all islands including Gogeum, where the construction of the landing bridge is in full swing, as well as birthdays and weekdays, are all islands within the island. In addition to the main island of Wando, I also visited Myeongsasimni Beach, which Shinjido, which was connected by a landing bridge. Myeongsasimni Beach, which is a popular summer vacation destination, boasted a beautiful coast as its name.

View from Wando Chunghae Ruins (Jangdo)
Blueprinted ruins of General Jang Bogo

Let's look at the map of Wando first. Go straight across the intersection and cross the Wando Bridge to reach the Chungcheong ruins, then turn clockwise in order from Mongdol Beach, Cheonghae Pogu Shooting Site, and Wando Arboretum.

Chungcheong ruins with traces of Silla
Turn right at the three-way street and turn in the reverse order. Of course, it's free to choose only your favorite.
Chungcheong ruins with traces of Silla
It runs about 10km along the 13th national road from Wando Bridge to reach Jangdo (Janggun Island) where the cleared ruins of Jangbogo, the sea king of Silla era, were found. Now, the wooden bridge can be placed at any time of the day, but in the past it was time to meet the water. Entering Jangdo Cheonghaeji (Historic No. 308), you can see the appearance of Cheonghae at that time by restoring the outer gate and introspection gate.
Statue of Jang Bo-go at the site of Chung-Jeong's Ruins
The Haesin Bulmok-ri Set site, which is located not far from Chungcheong's ruins, was closed on August 5, 2014 to prevent safety accidents due to the risk of deterioration of facilities.
Jangbogo Memorial Hall

Here are a few things you need to know to enrich your trip to Wando. Born in Wando, it is a general named Jang Bogo. One thousand years ago, Cheonghae, which seized the East Asian maritime rights from Silla, China, Japan, and Southwest Asia, was located in Wando, and Jangbogo was at the center.

Cheonghae Pogu Shooting Site
Jang Bogo planted a camp in Jangdo to slay pirates and seize the maritime rights. Born of a humble status, but with excellent martial arts, he went to the Tang Dynasty and saw the Tang pirates kidnap and sell the new lines to Nobi.
Cheonghae Pogu Shooting Site
And it will start the trade trade between Japan and Tang. Jang Bogo contributed to Silla's leadership in maritime trade between Silla, Japan and Tang.
Cheonghae Pogu Shooting Site
The traces can be found in the Jangja-ri Daejari area, centered on Jangdo, a cleared historical site. This is because there are ship docks, Saturn and wells. It is the trace of the best international trade port of the 9th century.
Cheonghaepo-gu Shooting Range
How many boats were carried by this waterway that contained a jewel-like island? Leaving behind, she crosses Shinji Bridge and heads for Myeongsasimni.
Cheonghaepo-gu Shooting Range
Myeongsasimni Beach Fine Sand VS. To mondol including the old quarter

Myeongsasimni Beach, which means 'the sound of sand crying across the streets.' Fine sand shines in the light. With its fine sand and shallow water, it is a popular space for family vacationers. Children dressed in short sleeves are playing in the water. There are plenty of places to take care of accommodation, including pensions, campsites and restaurants. There is also a convenience store near the parking lot, so there is no difficulty to have a neck or snack.

Shinji Myeongsasimni Beach

After returning to the main island of Wando again, run south to reach Mongdol Beach Gugyeung (Scenic Spot No. 3). 'The stones form nine steps' are filled with mondols of various sizes, ranging from small chestnuts to dinosaurs. It is a viewpoint that is considered a sunset point. Occasionally there are tourists trying to take them against Mondol, which is difficult. A 'place in place' campaign is underway.

Shinji Myeongsasimni Beach

If you have seen the old seasons, head to the Cheonghaepo-gu shooting site. Cheonghae Pogu filming site in the small pogu is a place where the drama 'Haesin' and 'Jeongjeon', as well as the recently released <Myeongnyang> were filmed. Buildings such as pier, muzzles, ships and other objectives, buildings, dungeons, military barracks, and watchtowers are located. It is also considered a sunset point. It takes about 40 minutes to see it. If you like movies and dramas, you can add fun to the shooting location. There is also a shop where you can have light food and snacks inside. There is no General Bogo, who may have been here someday, but the waterway he looked at still holds its place.

Old stone beach
